newsitem.title: UK: IBCA affirms Istituto Mobiliare Italiano.
newsitem.headline: IBCA affirms Istituto Mobiliare Italiano.

text.p: IBCA, the European credit rating agency, said on Wednesday it affirmed its ratings for Istituto Mobiliare Italiano (IMI).
Its short- and long-term ratings are A1 plus and AA minus respectively, with an Individual rating of A/B and a Legal rating of 2, IBCA said in a statement.
IBCA said the ratings reflect IMI's position as the market leader in Italian medium/long-term lending with a market share of 18 percent at end-1995.
"IMI's business is profitable and well diversified and, throughout the Italian recession, the bank has maintained its sound asset quality," IBCA said in a statement.

The agency said IMI has a high level of capitalisation. In the first six-months of 1996, the bank confirmed its position, reporting an increase in net income over the same period in 1995, as a result of higher interest revenue, lower loan loss provisions and a fall in staff costs, IBCA said.
